channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023100148
item.description:
Report E-2023100148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSG experienced a UN3103 TBPB release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors for containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to the box only due to the vented cap releasing as a result of load shift. The jugs were removed from the impacted box and wiped down for shipment on. The impacted cardboard was neutralized with water and containerized along with the impacted rags and PPE into a vented 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100004
item.description:
Report E-2023100004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and terminal floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to damaged valve assembly causing the release of material. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining material in the damaged 330-gallon metal tote to eight 55-gallon metal drums. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and collected the spent material and placed into one of the 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
